text: John Dickinson Dopf Mansion is a historic home located at Rock Port, Atchison County, Missouri. It was built in 1876, and is a two-story, Second Empire style brick dwelling. It features a mansard roof ornamented with alternating bands of hexagonal and square slate shingles and a one-story front porch. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1984. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Second Empire architecture in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1876 Category:Buildings and structures in Atchison County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Atchison County, Missouri
title: John Dickinson Dopf Mansion
